glsa.title: APR Utility Library: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Apache Portable Runtime Utility Library might enable remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service or disclose sensitive information.

background.p: The Apache Portable Runtime Utility Library (aka apr-util) provides an interface to functionality such as XML parsing, string matching and databases connections.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the APR Utility Library:

ul.li: Matthew Palmer reported a heap-based buffer underflow while compiling search patterns in the apr_strmatch_precompile() function in strmatch/apr_strmatch.c (CVE-2009-0023).
kcope reported that the expat XML parser in xml/apr_xml.c does not limit the amount of XML entities expanded recursively (CVE-2009-1955).
C. Michael Pilato reported an off-by-one error in the apr_brigade_vprintf() function in buckets/apr_brigade.c (CVE-2009-1956).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service (crash or memory exhaustion) via an Apache HTTP server running mod_dav or mod_dav_svn, or using several configuration files. Additionally, a remote attacker could disclose sensitive information or cause a Denial of Service by sending a specially crafted input. NOTE: Only big-endian architectures such as PPC and HPPA are affected by the latter flaw.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
